snippet: The company’s ambitious oil exploration program in the Arctic has been hindered by delays for the last seven years.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell, suffering another blow to its Alaskan Arctic drilling program, decides to tow its two drill vessels from there to Asian ports for major repairs, jeopardizing its plans to begin drilling for oil in summer 2013; delay does not necessarily doom Shell's seven-year, $4.5 billion exploration program, but it may strengthen position of anti-drilling environmentalists.
lead_paragraph: The company’s ambitious oil exploration program in the Arctic has been hindered by delays for the last seven years.

headline.seo: Shell’s Move to Fix Drill Vessels Imperils Arctic Plans
headline.main: Shell Vessels Sidelined, Imperiling Arctic Plans
headline.print_headline: Shell Vessels Sidelined, Imperiling Arctic Plans
